trashday

Class TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.speech.speechlet.lambda.SpeechletRequestStreamHandler
      • trashday.TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.RequestStreamHandler

    public class TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler
extends SpeechletRequestStreamHandler
    Ensure the Alexa request is intended for our service and pass it on to our TrashDaySpeechlet.

    All Alexa skills are required to validate that requests are sent by the correct, registered Amazon skill (see links below). Since our application code is posted publicly, this application id must be kept secret (i.e. not hard-coded). Therefore, the Trash Day application requires an environment variable ApplicationId to be set to the correct value for the registered Traash Day skill. If not available, the application will exit before allowing any information to be processed.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    J. Todd Baldwin
    See Also:
    Alexa Skills Kit Doc: Handling Requests Sent By Alexa, Certification Requirements for Custom Skills, Skills Hosted as Lambda Functions, Verifying that the Request is Intended for Your Service

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler

        public TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler()
                                      throws IllegalStateException
        Handle requests using the Amazon Dynamo DB cloud. Used for normal Alexa skill requests.

        CoberturaIgnore directive used since we do not want to build JUnit tests that connect to the actual Amazon Dynamo DB cloud.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the environment does not define "applicationId" then this Alexa skill will not start.

      • TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler

        public TrashDaySpeechletRequestStreamHandler(AmazonDynamoDBClient db,
                                             String tableNameOverride)
                                      throws IllegalStateException
        Handle requests using a specified Dynamo DB. Used only for JUnit tests at this time.
        Parameters:
        db - specific Dynamo DB (instead of the default Dynamo DB cloud)
        tableNameOverride - String table name used by JUnit tests to ensure they do not write to the Production table name (which is hard-coded using @DynamoDBTable in DynamoItem). A null value indicates no override. Any other value is the Dynamo table name to be used.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the environment does not define "applicationId" then this Alexa skill will not start.
